name: Tomato Soup
ingredients: tomato, onion, garlic, vegetable broth, olive oil, salt, pepper
description: A delicious tomato soup that warms the soul perfect for chilly days.
cooking_steps: 1. **Prepare the Ingredients**: Wash and roughly chop 4 cups of ripe tomatoes. Peel and finely chop 1 medium onion and mince 2 cloves of garlic. Have 4 cups of vegetable broth ready.|2. **Heat the Oil**: In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Ensure the oil is shimmering but not smoking.|3. **Sauté the Onions**: Add the chopped onion to the pot. Sauté, stirring occasionally, until the onions become translucent and slightly softened, about 5 minutes. This releases their sweetness.|4. **Add Garlic**: Stir in the minced garlic cloves. Cook for another 1-2 minutes, until fragrant. Be careful not to burn the garlic, as it will become bitter.|5. **Add Tomatoes and Broth**: Pour the chopped tomatoes into the pot, followed by 4 cups of vegetable broth. Stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a rolling boil.|6. **Simmer the Soup**: Reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot and let the soup simmer for 20 minutes. This allows the flavors to meld together and the tomatoes to soften completely.|7. **Blend the Soup**: Remove the pot from the heat. Use an immersion blender to blend the soup directly in the pot until it is completely smooth and creamy. Alternatively, you can transfer the soup to a regular blender in batches, being careful to avoid hot splashes.|8. **Season to Taste**: Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste. Start with a small amount and adjust as needed. You can also add a pinch of sugar to balance the acidity of the tomatoes.|9. **Optional: Add Fresh Herbs**: If desired, stir in 1 tablespoon of chopped fresh basil or parsley for added flavor and freshness. Let it simmer for another 2-3 minutes.|10. **Serve Hot**: Ladle the hot tomato soup into bowls. Garnish with a swirl of cream or a sprinkle of croutons if desired. Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: chicken breast, broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, sesame oil
description: A quick and healthy stir-fry with tender chicken and crisp vegetables in a savory sauce.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare the Ingredients: Cut 1 lb of chicken breast into thin strips. Chop 1 head of broccoli into florets. Slice 2 carrots and 1 bell pepper into strips. Mince 2 cloves of garlic and grate 1 inch of ginger. Have 1/4 cup of soy sauce ready.|2. Heat the Oil: In a large skillet or wok, heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil over high heat. The pan should be very hot.|3. Cook the Chicken: Add the chicken strips to the hot pan. Cook, stirring frequently, until the chicken is cooked through and lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.|4. Sauté the Vegetables: Add the broccoli, carrots, and bell peppers to the same pan. Stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, until the vegetables are tender-crisp. You want them to retain some crunch.|5. Add Garlic and Ginger: Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pan. Stir-fry for another minute, until fragrant.|6. Return the Chicken: Return the cooked chicken to the pan. Pour in the soy sauce. Stir to combine everything.|7. Simmer the Sauce: Let the mixture simmer for 2-3 minutes, allowing the sauce to thicken slightly and the flavors to meld.|8. Season to Taste: Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed. You can add more soy sauce or a pinch of red pepper flakes for heat.|9. Serve Hot: Serve the chicken stir-fry immediately over rice or noodles. Garnish with sesame seeds if desired.

name: Pancakes
ingredients: flour, milk, eggs, sugar, baking powder, butter
description: Fluffy and golden pancakes, perfect for a weekend breakfast.
cooking_steps: 1. Mix Dry Ingredients: In a large bowl, whisk together 1 cup of all-purpose flour, 2 tablespoons of sugar, and 2 teaspoons of baking powder.|2. Combine Wet Ingredients: In a separate bowl, whisk together 1 cup of milk and 2 eggs.|3. Combine Wet and Dry: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Whisk until just combined. Do not overmix; a few lumps are okay.|4. Heat the Griddle: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium heat. You can use butter or cooking spray.|5. Cook the Pancakes: Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and bubbles form on the surface and the edges start to set.|6. Flip the Pancakes: Flip the pancakes with a spatula and cook for another 2-3 minutes on the other side.|7. Keep Warm: Transfer the cooked pancakes to a plate and keep them warm in a low oven if needed.|8. Serve Immediately: Serve the pancakes hot with your favorite toppings, such as maple syrup, butter, or fresh fruit.

name: Guacamole
ingredients: avocado, lime juice, onion, cilantro, jalapeno, salt
description: A creamy and flavorful dip or spread, perfect with tortilla chips or on toast.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare the Avocados: Cut 2 ripe avocados in half, remove the pits, and scoop the flesh into a medium bowl.|2. Mash the Avocados: Use a fork or a potato masher to mash the avocados until smooth or slightly chunky, depending on your preference.|3. Add Lime Juice: Squeeze the juice of 1 lime over the mashed avocados. This prevents browning and adds a tangy flavor.|4. Chop the Ingredients: Finely chop 1/4 cup of red onion, 2 tablespoons of cilantro, and 1 jalapeno (remove seeds for less heat).|5. Combine Ingredients: Add the chopped onion, cilantro, and jalapeno to the mashed avocados. Stir to combine.|6. Season with Salt: Add salt to taste. Start with 1/2 teaspoon and adjust as needed.|7. Mix Well: Mix all the ingredients thoroughly until well combined.|8. Serve Immediately: Serve the guacamole immediately with tortilla chips, vegetable sticks, or as a topping for tacos or toast.

name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
ingredients: spaghetti, garlic, olive oil, red pepper flakes, parsley, salt, pepper
description: A simple and flavorful pasta dish with garlic and olive oil.
cooking_steps: 1. Cook the Pasta: Cook 1 lb of spaghetti according to package directions until al dente. Drain, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.|2. Prepare the Garlic: While the pasta cooks, mince 6 cloves of garlic.|3. Heat the Oil: In a large skillet, heat 1/2 cup of olive oil over medium-low heat.|4. Sauté the Garlic: Add the minced garlic and 1/2 teaspoon of red pepper flakes to the hot oil. Cook, stirring frequently, until the garlic is fragrant and lightly golden, about 2-3 minutes. Do not burn the garlic.|5. Add Pasta and Water: Add the cooked pasta to the skillet. Toss to coat with the garlic oil. Add 1/2 cup of the reserved pasta water and toss again.|6. Simmer and Thicken: Simmer for 1-2 minutes, allowing the sauce to thicken slightly. Add more pasta water if needed.|7. Season and Garnish: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in 1/4 cup of chopped fresh parsley.|8. Serve Hot: Serve immediately, garnished with extra parsley and grated Parmesan cheese if desired.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: flour, butter, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, chocolate chips
description: Classic chocolate chip cookies with a chewy center and crispy edges.
cooking_steps: 1. Preheat Oven: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).|2. Cream Butter and Sugars: In a large bowl, cream together 1 cup of softened butter, 3/4 cup of granulated sugar, and 3/4 cup of packed brown sugar until smooth.|3. Add Eggs and Vanilla: Beat in 2 eggs one at a time, then stir in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.|4. Combine Dry Ingredients: In a separate bowl, whisk together 2 1/4 cups of all-purpose flour and 1 teaspoon of baking soda.|5. Combine Wet and Dry: Gradually stir the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until just combined.|6. Add Chocolate Chips: Stir in 2 cups of chocolate chips.|7. Bake the Cookies: Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until golden brown.|8. Cool and Serve: Let the cookies cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken
ingredients: chicken, lemon, rosemary, thyme, garlic, olive oil, salt, pepper
description: A flavorful roasted chicken with lemon and herbs.
cooking_steps: 1. Preheat Oven: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).|2. Prepare the Chicken: Rinse and pat dry a whole chicken (about 3-4 lbs).|3. Prepare the Herbs and Garlic: Chop 2 tablespoons of fresh rosemary and 2 tablespoons of fresh thyme. Mince 4 cloves of garlic.|4. Season the Chicken: In a small bowl, combine the chopped herbs, minced garlic, 1/4 cup of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Rub the mixture all over the chicken, including inside the cavity.|5. Add Lemon: Cut 1 lemon in half. Place one half inside the chicken cavity. Slice the other half and place the slices around the chicken.|6. Roast the Chicken: Place the chicken in a roasting pan. Roast for 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.|7. Rest Before Carving: Let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving.|8. Serve Hot: Carve the chicken and serve hot with the roasted lemon slices and pan juices.

name: Avial
ingredients: mixed vegetables, coconut oil, coconut milk, curry leaves, green chilies, yogurt, turmeric
description: A traditional Kerala mixed vegetable dish cooked in coconut milk and yogurt.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare Vegetables: Chop 1 cup each of carrots, drumsticks, potatoes, snake gourd, and raw bananas into 2-inch pieces. Chop 2 green chilies lengthwise.|2. Cook Vegetables: In a large pot, combine the chopped vegetables, 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric powder, and salt. Add enough water to cover the vegetables. Cook until they are tender but not mushy.|3. Grind Coconut Paste: Grind 1 cup of grated coconut with 2 green chilies into a coarse paste.|4. Add Coconut Paste: Add the ground coconut paste to the cooked vegetables. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.|5. Add Yogurt: Whisk 1/2 cup of yogurt until smooth. Add it to the vegetable mixture. Stir gently and cook for another 2-3 minutes on low heat. Do not boil.|6. Temper with Coconut Oil: Heat 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a small pan. Add 1 teaspoon of mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add a few curry leaves and pour the tempering over the avial.|7. Mix and Serve: Mix well and serve hot with rice.

name: Kerala Fish Curry (Meen Curry)
ingredients: fish, coconut oil, coconut milk, shallots, ginger, garlic, curry leaves, tamarind, chili powder, coriander powder
description: A spicy and tangy fish curry cooked in coconut milk, a staple of Kerala cuisine.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare Fish: Cut 1 lb of fish (kingfish or seer fish) into medium-sized pieces. Marinate with a pinch of turmeric and salt.|2. Prepare Ingredients: Chop 10 shallots, mince 1 inch of ginger and 4 cloves of garlic. Soak a small ball of tamarind in warm water and extract the juice.|3. Heat Oil: Heat 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a pot. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add curry leaves and shallots. Sauté until golden brown.|4. Add Ginger and Garlic: Add minced ginger and garlic. Sauté until fragrant.|5. Add Spices: Add 2 teaspoons of chili powder, 1 teaspoon of coriander powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric powder. Sauté for a minute.|6. Add Tamarind Juice: Pour in the tamarind extract and salt. Bring to a boil.|7. Add Fish: Gently add the fish pieces. Cook until the fish is cooked through, about 10-15 minutes.|8. Add Coconut Milk: Pour in 1 cup of thick coconut milk. Simmer for 5 minutes. Do not boil.|9. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with curry leaves and serve hot with rice.

name: Thalassery Biryani
ingredients: rice, chicken/mutton, ghee, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, spices, mint leaves, coriander leaves
description: A flavorful biryani from the Thalassery region of Kerala, known for its unique blend of spices and rice.
cooking_steps: 1. Marinate Meat: Marinate 1 kg of chicken/mutton with ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and yogurt for 1 hour.|2. Fry Onions: Slice 4 large onions thinly. Fry them in ghee until golden brown. Set aside half for garnishing.|3. Prepare Masala: In the same ghee, add ginger-garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, green chilies, and spice powders. Sauté until oil separates. Add marinated meat and cook until tender.|4. Cook Rice: Cook 1 kg of Kaima rice with water and salt until 75% done. Drain.|5. Layer Biryani: In a large pot, layer half of the rice, meat masala, fried onions, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Top with the remaining rice.|6. Drizzle Ghee: Drizzle ghee over the rice and cover the pot tightly.|7. Dum Cooking: Cook on low heat for 20-30 minutes.|8. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with remaining fried onions and serve hot with raita.

name: Appam with Stew
ingredients: rice flour, coconut milk, sugar, yeast, vegetable stew (carrots, potatoes, beans, coconut milk, spices)
description: Lacy, bowl-shaped pancakes with crispy edges and a soft center, served with a creamy vegetable stew.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare Appam Batter: Soak 1 cup of raw rice for 4 hours. Grind into a smooth batter with 1/2 cup of cooked rice, 1/2 cup of grated coconut, and water. Add 1 teaspoon of yeast and 1 tablespoon of sugar. Ferment for 8 hours.|2. Prepare Vegetable Stew: Chop 1 cup each of carrots, potatoes, and beans. Cook with 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric and salt.|3. Sauté Spices: Heat 2 tablespoons of coconut oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, shallots, ginger, and green chilies. Sauté until golden.|4. Add Vegetables and Coconut Milk: Add the cooked vegetables to the sautéed spices. Pour in 1 cup of thick coconut milk. Simmer for 10 minutes.|5. Cook Appam: Heat an appam pan. Pour a ladleful of batter and swirl. Cover and cook until the edges are crispy and the center is soft.|6. Serve Hot: Serve the appam hot with the vegetable stew.

name: Dal Makhani
ingredients: black lentils, kidney beans, butter, cream, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, spices
description: A rich and creamy lentil dish from North India, slow-cooked for hours.
cooking_steps: 1. Soak Lentils and Beans: Soak 1 cup of black lentils and 1/4 cup of kidney beans overnight.|2. Cook Lentils and Beans: Cook the soaked lentils and beans with 4 cups of water, 1 teaspoon of turmeric, and salt until tender. Mash slightly.|3. Prepare Masala: Heat 2 tablespoons of butter. Add cumin seeds, ginger-garlic paste, and chopped tomatoes. Sauté until oil separates.|4. Add Spices: Add chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Sauté for a minute.|5. Combine Lentils and Masala: Add the cooked lentils and beans to the masala. Add 1 cup of water and simmer for 30 minutes.|6. Add Butter and Cream: Add 2 tablespoons of butter and 1/2 cup of cream. Simmer for another 15 minutes.|7. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with fresh cream and coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
ingredients: paneer, tomatoes, onions, cashews, cream, butter, spices
description: A rich and creamy paneer dish with a tomato-cashew gravy.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare Paneer: Cut 250g of paneer into cubes. Lightly fry them in butter and set aside.|2. Prepare Gravy: Grind 1 cup of chopped onions, 1 cup of chopped tomatoes, and 1/4 cup of cashews into a smooth paste.|3. Sauté Spices: Heat 2 tablespoons of butter. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, and cardamom. Sauté for a minute.|4. Add Gravy Paste: Add the ground paste and sauté until oil separates.|5. Add Spices: Add chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and sugar. Sauté for a minute.|6. Add Cream and Paneer: Add 1/2 cup of cream and the fried paneer. Simmer for 10 minutes.|7. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Rasam
ingredients: tamarind, tomatoes, lentils, spices, curry leaves, mustard seeds, asafoetida
description: A tangy and spicy South Indian soup, often served with rice.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare Tamarind: Soak a small ball of tamarind in warm water and extract the juice.|2. Cook Lentils: Cook 1/4 cup of toor dal until soft and mash it.|3. Prepare Tomatoes: Chop 2 ripe tomatoes.|4. Heat Oil: Heat 1 tablespoon of ghee or oil. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida. Let them splutter.|5. Add Curry Leaves and Chilies: Add curry leaves and dry red chilies. Sauté for a few seconds.|6. Add Tomatoes and Turmeric: Add the chopped tomatoes and 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric powder. Sauté until the tomatoes are soft.|7. Add Tamarind and Lentils: Add the tamarind extract, mashed lentils, and salt. Bring to a boil.|8. Add Rasam Powder: Add 1 tablespoon of rasam powder. Simmer for 5 minutes.|9. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: chicken, yogurt, spices, tomatoes, cream, butter
description: Marinated chicken grilled and simmered in a creamy tomato sauce.
cooking_steps: 1. Marinate Chicken: Marinate 1 kg of boneless chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and lemon juice for 1 hour.|2. Grill Chicken: Grill the marinated chicken pieces until cooked.|3. Prepare Gravy: Heat 2 tablespoons of butter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté.|4. Add Tomatoes and Spices: Add chopped tomatoes, chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Sauté until oil separates.|5. Add Cream and Butter: Add 1/2 cup of cream and 2 tablespoons of butter. Simmer for 5 minutes.|6. Add Chicken: Add the grilled chicken pieces to the gravy. Simmer for 10 minutes.|7. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Upma
ingredients: semolina, mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, onions, green chilies, water
description: A savory South Indian breakfast dish made with semolina.
cooking_steps: 1. Roast Semolina: Dry roast 1 cup of semolina until lightly golden. Set aside.|2. Heat Oil: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add mustard seeds and urad dal. Let them splutter.|3. Add Curry Leaves and Chilies: Add curry leaves and green chilies. Sauté for a few seconds.|4. Add Onions: Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.|5. Add Water: Add 2 cups of water and salt. Bring to a boil.|6. Add Semolina: Gradually add the roasted semolina, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.|7. Cook Upma: Cook until the upma thickens and absorbs all the water.|8. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Palak Paneer
ingredients: paneer, spinach, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, spices, cream
description: A creamy spinach and paneer dish, popular in North India.
cooking_steps: 1. Blanch Spinach: Blanch 500g of spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and blend into a smooth puree.|2. Prepare Paneer: Cut 250g of paneer into cubes. Lightly fry them and set aside.|3. Prepare Gravy: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add cumin seeds, chopped onions, and sauté until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté.|4. Add Tomatoes and Spices: Add chopped tomatoes, chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Sauté until oil separates.|5. Add Spinach Puree: Add the spinach puree and salt. Simmer for 10 minutes.|6. Add Paneer and Cream: Add the fried paneer and 1/4 cup of cream. Simmer for 5 minutes.|7. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with cream and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Aloo Gobi
ingredients: potatoes, cauliflower, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, spices
description: A dry vegetable dish with potatoes and cauliflower, flavored with Indian spices.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare Vegetables: Chop 2 medium potatoes and 1 medium cauliflower into florets.|2. Heat Oil: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.|3. Add Onions and Ginger-Garlic: Add chopped onions and sauté until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté.|4. Add Tomatoes and Spices: Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Sauté until oil separates.|5. Add Potatoes and Cauliflower: Add the chopped potatoes and cauliflower florets. Mix well.|6. Cook Vegetables: Add salt and a little water. Cover and cook until the vegetables are tender.|7. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Masala Dosa
ingredients: rice, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, potatoes, onions, mustard seeds, curry leaves
description: A crispy South Indian crepe filled with a spiced potato mixture.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare Batter: Soak 2 cups of rice and 1 cup of urad dal with 1 teaspoon of fenugreek seeds for 4 hours. Grind into a smooth batter and ferment overnight.|2. Prepare Potato Filling: Boil 4 potatoes, peel, and mash them. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves. Add chopped onions and sauté. Add turmeric powder and mashed potatoes. Mix well.|3. Cook Dosa: Heat a griddle. Pour a ladleful of batter and spread into a thin circle. Drizzle oil and cook until crispy.|4. Fill Dosa: Place a portion of the potato filling in the center of the dosa. Fold and serve hot with sambar and chutney.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: chickpeas, flour, yogurt, spices, oil
description: A spicy chickpea curry served with deep-fried bread, a popular North Indian dish.
cooking_steps: 1. Soak Chickpeas: Soak 1 cup of chickpeas overnight.|2. Cook Chickpeas: Cook the soaked chickpeas with 1 teaspoon of baking soda, bay leaf, and cardamom until tender.|3. Prepare Chole Masala: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add cumin seeds, chopped onions, and sauté. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté. Add chopped tomatoes, chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and amchur powder. Sauté until oil separates.|4. Combine Chickpeas and Masala: Add the cooked chickpeas to the masala. Simmer for 15 minutes.|5. Prepare Bhature Dough: Mix 2 cups of all-purpose flour with 1/4 cup of semolina, 1/4 cup of yogurt, and salt. Knead into a soft dough and let it rest for 30 minutes.|6. Fry Bhature: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll them into circles and deep-fry until golden brown.|7. Serve Hot: Serve the chole hot with the bhature.

name: Vada Pav
ingredients: potatoes, gram flour, spices, bread rolls, chutneys
description: A popular Mumbai street food consisting of a spiced potato fritter in a bread roll.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare Potato Filling: Boil 4 potatoes, peel, and mash them. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Add turmeric powder and mashed potatoes. Mix well.|2. Prepare Gram Flour Batter: Mix 1 cup of gram flour with 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda, chili powder, and salt. Add water to make a smooth batter.|3. Make Potato Balls: Make small balls from the potato filling.|4. Fry Vada: Dip the potato balls in the gram flour batter and deep-fry until golden brown.|5. Prepare Pav: Slice bread rolls (pav) in half.|6. Assemble Vada Pav: Spread green chutney and tamarind chutney on the pav. Place the fried vada in the pav.|7. Serve Hot: Serve the vada pav hot with dry garlic chutney.

name: Dhokla
ingredients: gram flour, yogurt, ginger, green chilies, baking soda, mustard seeds, curry leaves
description: A steamed savory cake from Gujarat, made with gram flour.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare Batter: Mix 1 cup of gram flour with 1/2 cup of yogurt, 1 teaspoon of ginger-green chili paste, 1/4 teaspoon of turmeric powder, and salt. Add water to make a smooth batter.|2. Add Baking Soda: Add 1 teaspoon of baking soda and mix well.|3. Steam Dhokla: Pour the batter into a greased steaming plate. Steam for 15-20 minutes.|4. Prepare Tempering: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Let them splutter.|5. Pour Tempering: Pour the tempering over the steamed dhokla.|6. Cut and Serve: Cut the dhokla into squares and serve hot with chutney.

name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: chicken, tomatoes, butter, cream, spices, ginger, garlic
description: Tender chicken cooked in a rich, buttery tomato sauce.
cooking_steps: 1. Marinate Chicken: Marinate 1 kg of boneless chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala for 1 hour.|2. Grill Chicken: Grill the marinated chicken pieces until cooked.|3. Prepare Gravy: Heat 2 tablespoons of butter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté.|4. Add Tomatoes and Spices: Add chopped tomatoes, chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and kasuri methi. Sauté until oil separates.|5. Add Cream and Butter: Add 1/2 cup of cream and 2 tablespoons of butter. Simmer for 5 minutes.|6. Add Chicken: Add the grilled chicken pieces to the gravy. Simmer for 10 minutes.|7. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with cream and coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Rajma Chawal
ingredients: kidney beans, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, spices, rice
description: A North Indian dish of red kidney beans in a thick gravy, served with rice.
cooking_steps: 1. Soak Kidney Beans: Soak 1 cup of kidney beans overnight.|2. Cook Kidney Beans: Cook the soaked kidney beans with water and salt until tender.|3. Prepare Gravy: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add cumin seeds, chopped onions, and sauté until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté.|4. Add Tomatoes and Spices: Add chopped tomatoes, chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and amchur powder. Sauté until oil separates.|5. Combine Kidney Beans and Gravy: Add the cooked kidney beans to the gravy. Simmer for 20 minutes.|6. Prepare Rice: Cook rice separately.|7. Serve Hot: Serve the rajma hot with rice.

name: Aloo Paratha
ingredients: potatoes, wheat flour, spices, ghee
description: Flatbread stuffed with a spiced potato mixture, a popular North Indian breakfast.
cooking_steps: 1. Prepare Potato Filling: Boil 4 potatoes, peel, and mash them. Add chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.|2. Prepare Dough: Knead 2 cups of wheat flour with water and salt into a soft dough.|3. Stuff Paratha: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll them out and stuff with the potato filling. Seal the edges.|4. Cook Paratha: Roll out the stuffed dough into a flatbread. Cook on a hot griddle with ghee until golden brown.|5. Serve Hot: Serve the aloo paratha hot with yogurt or pickle.

name: Chicken 65
ingredients: chicken, yogurt, ginger, garlic, curry leaves, chili powder, cornflour
description: Spicy, deep-fried chicken appetizer from South India.
cooking_steps: 1. Marinate Chicken: Marinate 500g of boneless chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, cornflour, and lemon juice for 30 minutes.|2. Deep-fry Chicken: Deep-fry the marinated chicken pieces until golden brown and cooked.|3. Prepare Tempering: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add curry leaves, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste. Sauté for a few seconds.|4. Add Chicken: Add the fried chicken pieces to the tempering. Toss well.|5. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: rice, mixed vegetables, yogurt, spices, mint leaves, coriander leaves
description: A fragrant rice dish cooked with mixed vegetables and aromatic spices.
cooking_steps: 1. Soak Rice: Soak 1 kg of basmati rice for 30 minutes.|2. Cook Vegetables: Cook mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, potatoes) with turmeric powder and salt.|3. Prepare Masala: Heat 2 tablespoons of ghee. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, cardamom, and cinnamon. Add chopped onions and sauté. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté. Add chopped tomatoes, chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and yogurt. Sauté until oil separates.|4. Layer Biryani: Layer half of the rice, cooked vegetables, masala, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Top with the remaining rice.|5. Drizzle Ghee and Saffron: Drizzle ghee and saffron water over the rice.|6. Dum Cooking: Cook on low heat for 20-30 minutes.|7. Serve Hot: Serve the vegetable biryani hot with raita.

name: Sambar
ingredients: lentils, mixed vegetables, tamarind, sambar powder, mustard seeds, curry leaves
description: A tangy lentil and vegetable stew from South India, served with rice or idli.
cooking_steps: 1. Cook Lentils: Cook 1/2 cup of toor dal until soft.|2. Prepare Vegetables: Chop mixed vegetables (drumsticks, carrots, onions, tomatoes).|3. Prepare Tamarind: Soak a small ball of tamarind in warm water and extract the juice.|4. Heat Oil: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and curry leaves. Let them splutter.|5. Add Onions and Vegetables: Add chopped onions and vegetables. Sauté until tender.|6. Add Tamarind and Sambar Powder: Add tamarind extract, 2 tablespoons of sambar powder, and salt. Simmer for 15 minutes.|7. Add Lentils: Add the cooked lentils and mix well. Simmer for 10 minutes.|8. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or idli.
